Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); GRAECO-ROMAN PERIOD (not after)
Name: Sokar
Description: This plastered and painted wooden statue, once part of the Ã‰. de Meester de Ravestein collection, probably decorated a coffin or canopic chest. It depicts Sokar, the patron god of the Memphite necropolis. He is shown as a falcon and probably wore a crown with a sun disk and two feathers on top of ram's horns.
